question: A physical verification of all the fixed assets should be undertaken at least once in

question: A physical verification of all the consumable goods and materials should be undertaken at least once in
answer: A year

question: Complete physical verification of books should be done every year in case of libraries having books
answer: Not more than 20000

answer: at least once in 3 years.

question: physical verification for libraries having more than 50000 volumes shall be conducted

question: Reasonable loss in case of a library is

question: A material should generally be considered as surplus if
answer: It remains in stock for over a year.

question: while disposing of the surplus goods, value and prices that should be worked out are
answer: Book value, Guiding Price and Reserved Price.

question: The original purchase price of the goods in question may be utilised, where
answer: it is not possible to work out the book value,

question: The mode of disposal will be determined by the competent authority for surplus or obsolete or unserviceable goods with residual value
answer: Up-to â‚¹ 2 lakh

question: The mode of disposal will be either through advertised tender or public auction Where the residue value of surplus or obsolete or unserviceable goods is
answer: Above â‚¹ 2 lakh

question: Bid security in case of disposal of surplus or obsolete or unserviceable goods through advertised tender should be
answer: 10% of reserved price

question: If the price offered by highest bidder is not acceptable, negotiation may be held
answer: only with that bidder

question: Where the negotiation with the highest bidder does not provide the desired result,
answer: the reasonable or acceptable price may be counter offered to the next highest responsive bidder(s).

question: In case the total quantity to be disposed of cannot be taken up by the highest acceptable bidder, the remaining quantity may be offered to the
answer: next higher bidder(s) at the price offered by the highest acceptable bidder.

question: Full payment, i.e. the residual amount after adjusting the bid security should be obtained from the successful bidder before
answer: releasing the goods.

question: During disposal of surplus or obsolete or unserviceable goods through public auction, on acceptance of bid the earnest money should be taken is
answer: 25% of bid value.

question: The composition of the auction team decided by the competent authority will include an officer of
answer: the Internal Finance Wing of the department

question: If a Ministry/Department is unable to sell any surplus or obsolete or unserviceable item through permissible means, it may dispose of the same at its scrap value with approval of
answer: Competent authority in consultation with finance division.

question: In case the Ministry/Department is unable to sell the disposable items at its scrap value, it may
answer: adopt any other mode of disposal including destruction of the item in an eco-friendly manner.

question: Powers to write off of losses are mentioned in
answer: Delegation of Financial Powers Rules.

question: The heads under which losses due to depreciation are recorded are
answer: normal fluctuation of market prices; normal wear and tear; lack of foresight in regulating purchases; negligence after purchase.;

question: The heads under which losses not due to depreciation are recorded are
answer: losses due to theft or fraud; losses due to neglect; obsolescence of stores or purchases in excess of requirements; losses due to damage; losses due to force majeure condition such as flood, fire, enemy action etc.;
